description: A classic euro. I love the way you have to utilize your workers and make sure everything you want to use has a worker to operate it. I love that mechanic. A great game.

Don't play this often and generally with just the two of us as well.  We enjoy it, but it's beyond the limit of what our game-groups can play, so we haven't dared to introduce it yet.  Maybe after a few more games of San Juan...
It's okay. I'd be willing to play it most of the time but I don't know about the rest of my group.
Like a lot. Needed a pint of water after every play, a little too dry for me.

title: Certainly ...
description: Certainly a classic. Every game is different and there are many ways to win. Doesn't get too much play with us given the setup time and length of the game. Still one of my favorites regardless.Plays well with two, using the official variant posted here.Getting a bit more love on the iPad, my wife has also started playing it here.

title: Certainly ...
description: Certainly a classic. Every game is different and there are many ways to win. Doesn't get too much play with us given the setup time and length of the game. Still one of my favorites regardless.Plays well with two, using the official variant posted here.Getting a bit more love on the iPad, my wife has also started playing it here.

title: This is a ...
description: This is a good game, however, I think I agree with the complaints about differing player skill. Best if everyone is on the same ability level because this game is 'highly' dependent upon what happens to the right and left of you.  Takes a long time to set up and clean up as well.  I'd usually rather play something else these days.

title: Designer: ...
description: Designer: Andreas SeyfarthArtist: Harald Lieske, Franz VohwinkelPublisher: Alea / RavensburgerPlayer count: 2-5 (best with 4)Weight: medium Mechanics: role selection / city building / economic Setting: players are colonial governors on the island of Puerto Rico. The aim of the game is to amass victory points by shipping goods to Europe or by constructing buildingsTheme: fairPlay time: 90-120 minutesHaving played numerous games, both offline and online, I can fairly say that this is my favourite game. Despite its age, I haven't come across more recent games that rival this one. This is a strategic game, there is no luck involved, but the rules are fairly easy once you understand the game mechanism. There are several routes to success and usually it stays exciting to the end who will win the game. For non-gamers this one can be quite difficult at first, but after one or two games people know the mechanism and the various roles and buildings and what they do. The games works quite well with 2, 3, 4 or 5 players, which I consider a bonus as not many games do. I'm a fan and want to play this again anytime!I'm hoping to get my hands on the limited edition at a decent price and otherwise consider replacing this one by the reprint, which also includes both expansions.

title: A bit "dry...
description: A bit "dry" but still a deep game with lots of strategies to explore. Our group still don't "get" the game, but at least we're all on the same level!

title: can't real...
description: can't realy get my head around this... but still love it..

title: [SOLD, Jun...
description: [SOLD, Jun3 2017]This is the game that got me into "designer" boardgaming back in 2002 so it will always have a special place in my heart.  The very first game in my collection, the one that started it all.

title: Just had t...
description: Just had to get this classic. Mkm, I don't get the hype. Never again.

title: I liked th...
description: I liked this game. It has a huge rulebook, but once you get a hang of it, you'll love it.

title: Holds up v...
description: Holds up very nicely.  Will play any time.
